Description: Necklace: comprising beads of various shapes, dimensions and materials; the central section of the string comprises four large cornelian short bicone beads strung alternately with four rock crystal blue glazed drop-shaped beads (the suspension loops are made from the glaze); the rest of the string comprises a very large number of blue, green or blue-green glazed composition disc or short cylinder beads, with a lesser number of black glazed composition and several small cornelian short cylinder beads.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Abydos, Grave 1755 Found at the neck of a female
Curator's comments: Frankfort's date for the burial is based on the beads. The technique of making suspension loops of glaze is used on a quartz pebble (.3327) which is presumably of similar date. Also from this burial: amulets (1926,0728.163). Bibliography: H. Frankfort, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 16 (1930), 217; pl.XXXIV, fig. 3; Egypt Exploration Society, 'Exhibition of Antiquities from Abydos and Tell el-Armana 1925-6. Exhibited at the Rooms of the Society of Antiquaries, Burlington House, July 5th-24th, 1926' (London, 1926), 11, group IX, A.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (336)
